remarks: The elements of the span of an indexed collection of basic vectors are those vectors which can be written as finite linear combinations of basic vectors.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Feb-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ ellspd as of 24-Jun-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
ellspd.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` M ) $.
ellspd.v $e |- B = ( Base ` M ) $.
ellspd.k $e |- K = ( Base ` S ) $.
ellspd.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` M ) $.
ellspd.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` S ) $.
ellspd.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` M ) $.
ellspd.f $e |- ( ph -> F : I --> B ) $.
ellspd.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. LMod ) $.
ellspd.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. _V ) $.
ellspdOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( X e. ( N ` ( F " I ) ) <-> E. f e. ( K ^m I ) ( ( `' f " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin /\ X = ( M gsum ( f oF .x. F ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d .0. f $.
$d .x. f $.
$d B f $.
$d F f $.
$d I f $.
$d K f $.
$d M f $.
$d N f $.
$d S f $.
$d X f $.
$d f ph $.
